results.title: Auslang = Australian supply language
results.brief_description: About creating order from confusion and adapting a more disciplined approach to inventory identification in industry. Standard names are vital and AUSLANG (Australian Supply Language) offers a comprehensive dictionary together with colloquial cross references thus reducing the incidence of duplication of stock. AUSLANG was derived from the NATO codification system for Australian Industry use

results.title: Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: VSDC Services for Deaf Children, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and Raffi Ghazarian
results.brief_description: Brian Bemal presents 5 episodes of Auslan signing pertaining to general conversation: family, school, shopping, food and play, with each episode building on the next. The video is accompanied by a guidebook containing pages from the VSDC “Dictionary of Auslan” from which the numbered signs are taken. Approximately 900 signs are shown. Suitable for beginners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: VSDC Services for Deaf Children, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and Raffi Ghazarian

results.title: Auslan for families [five stories]
results.creator_credit: VSDC Services for Deaf Children, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and Raffi Ghazarian
results.brief_description: Companion piece to ‘Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5’ [313556], in which the signs demonstrated there are acted out in five scenes of varying length around the themes of family, school, shopping, food and play. Intended as a language teaching program for parents of deaf children from a non-English speaking background; a voiceover accompanies the signing. Performers include: Kathryn Smith, Gerard Hynes, Caitlyn Johnson, Trent Beasly.

results.title: Aurelia Steiner
results.brief_description:
Variations on the theme of love messages: the author reads a love letter written by a Jewish girl living in Melbourne while travelling along the Seine.

Credits: Producer, Henry Chapier ; director, Marguerite Duras ; writer, Marguerite Duras ; photography, Eric Dumage, Pierre Lhomme.

results.title: Aunty Nancy and the easyplay
results.brief_description: Just released from a mental hospital for the 10th time, Aunty Nancy comes to stay with the relatives and our fearless narrator must vacate her room, again. Aunty Nancy can usually be tolerated, but only just. All that changes when she brings the easyplay - an electronic keyboard where she subjects them to a myriad of variations on “Chopsticks”.

results.title: Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter
results.creator_credit: Cinecom Entertainment, Odyssey, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov and Jon Amiel
results.brief_description: Released in the United States as “Tune in tomorrow”, this is John Amiel’s screen version of Mario Vargas Llosa’s acclaimed novel “Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter”. Aunt Julia (Barbara Hershey), a double divorcee, returns to New Orleans at age 36 to find a wealthy third husband. Instead, she finds her 21-year-old nephew by marriage (Keanu Reeves), a local radio station newswriter, who falls in love with her. She succumbs to his advances, incurring her family’s anger. The plot is overlaid with the more complicated story of a dishevelled writer, Falk, who is new in town. Falk manipulates the nephew-aunt relationship in his radio soap opera which is laced with incest and anti-Albanian sentiment. This is a clever and witty romantic comedy that features an amazing supporting cast including John Laroquette, Elizabeth McGovern, Dennis Quaid and others.

results.title: Aujourd'hui en France: trois jours trois, photographes
results.brief_description: One of a series of films covering various aspects of the French lifestyle, history and culture. This film studies three French photographers - Jean-Loup Sieff, Robert Doisneau, Bruno Barbey - and their different styles.

results.title: Augusta
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Peter Jones and Anne Wheeler
results.brief_description: This film is the portrait of Augusta Evans, an 88-year-old Indian woman (the daughter of a Shuswap chief), who lives alone in a log cabin without running water or electricity. She recalls past times, but lives very much in the present. Self-sufficient, dedicated to her people, she spreads warmth wherever she moves with her songs, her harmonica and her soft-voiced comments. Award: San Francisco.

results.title: Audition (D)
results.creator_credit: Omega Project, Akemi Suyama and Miike Takashi
results.brief_description: Seven years after the death of his wife, Aoyama (Ryo Ishibashi) holds auditions for actresses in a film that is not going to be made as a means to find a suitable partner for him to marry. Through this process he meets and is entranced with Asami (Eihi Shiina), a striking woman with ballet training. After deciding to propose, Aoyama is prompted by his friend to check into the background of his intended and is alarmed to find that not only has Asami has lied about her job, but also about where she lives. Asami lives alone - except for the writhing victim she keeps tied up in a sack on the floor, minus his tongue, feet and half his fingers. Takashi’s fifth film is a tense and disturbing thriller, full of macabre surprises which, if known, would spoil some truly terrifying and sadistic actions of an emotionally scarred woman hell bent on vengeance. WARNING: The violence in “Audition” is an examination of the limits and bounds of sadism and revenge and is highly confronting and disturbing. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Audience contact
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This program in the ‘Speaking with confidence’ series covers the areas of eye contact, gesture, use of notes and lectern, as well as body movement. A sheet providing summary notes, suggested exercises, as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.
